item.title: Electronic Flight Instrument System (EFIS) Symbol Generators

remarks.para: Except for ER operations, one may be inoperative provided symbol generator isolation is verified once each flight day.

note.para: Operative symbol generators must be associated with operative IRS, radio altimeters and ILS receivers.
One EFIS system required at each pilot station. Instrument source selections must be made from separate sources.

numlitem.para: Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 3a.

placard.para: If Left or Right Symbol Generator is inoperative, placard L (R) EFI Source Select switch "L (R) EFI NORM INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
If Center Symbol Generator inoperative, placard both EFI Source Select switches "EFI ALTN INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Deferral for this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
If Left Symbol Generator inoperative, select ALTN on Captain's EFI source select. If Right Symbol Generator inoperative, select ALTN on F/O's EFI source select.
Ensure the Captain and First Officer are utilizing different Symbol Generators by performing the following:

With both L and R EFI switches in NORM, place the Captain’s EFIS control panel in the VOR mode and the First Officer’s EFIS control panel in the ILS mode. Observe that the VOR L is annunciated on the Captain’s HSI.

Ensure the Captain and First Officer are utilizing different Symbol Generators by performing the following: With Left EFI switch in ALTN and the Right EFI switch in NORM, place the First Officer’s EFIS control panel in the VOR mode and the Captain’s EFIS control panel in the ILS mode. Observe that the VOR R is annunciated on the First Officer’s HSI.

Ensure the Captain and First Officer are utilizing different Symbol Generators by performing the following: With Right EFI switch in ALTN and the Left EFI switch in NORM, place the Captain’s EFIS control panel in the VOR mode and the First Officer’s EFIS control panel in the ILS mode. Observe that the VOR L is annunciated on the Captain’s HSI.
